SEARCH
Package src

Class QueryDB

java.lang.Object
src.QueryDB
public class QueryDB extends Object
QueryDB is a Java program that connects to an SQLite database and executes predefined SQL queries based on user input. The program accepts a query number (1-6) as a command-line argument and, if required, additional parameters to execute specific queries.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws SQLException
      Main method that processes command-line arguments and executes the corresponding SQL query.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments: first argument should be an integer (1-6) indicating the query type. Additional arguments may be required depending on the query.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • throwArgsMessage

      public static void throwArgsMessage()
      Prints a generic usage message when invalid or no arguments are provided.

    • throwArgsMessage

      public static void throwArgsMessage(int queryNum, String message)
      Prints a usage message specifying required parameters for a specific query.
      Parameters:
      queryNum - The query number for which the message is being displayed.
      message - Description of the required parameters.

    • executeQuery

      public static ResultSet executeQuery(String query, Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Executes the given SQL query and prints the results.
      Parameters:
      query - The SQL query string to be executed.
      connection - The database connection object.
      Returns:
      A ResultSet containing the results of the query, or null if an error occurs.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • printResultSet

      public static void printResultSet(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException
      Prints the contents of a ResultSet to the console.
      Parameters:
      rs - The ResultSet containing the data to be printed.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
